thread.title: Spring Breaking College Teen Shot & Killed During Production Of D.C. Rap Video
thread.title_full: Spring Breaking College Teen Shot & Killed During Production Of D.C. Rap Video

author: Trent Clark
title: Spring Breaking College Teen Shot & Killed During Production Of D.C. Rap Video
text:
1 
Washington, D.C. – On Monday (March 20) Ayana McAllister, 18, was in attendance for a rap music video shoot in Northeast Washington, D.C. According to her father, Anthony McAllister, she was home on spring break from Saint Augustine’s University in Raleigh, North Carolina when tragedy struck. 
Sometime around 8:40 p.m., the college teen was fatally shot in the 4300 block of Benning Road, Northeast, NBC reports . Police also revealed a second woman was shot and hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries before they arrived. 
“That’s my baby. I just miss her warm smile, the close relationship that we have,” Anthony McAllister told the press. He says his daughter was watching the video shoot of a friend who is a rapper and “she was at the wrong place at the wrong time.” 
Authorities have yet to release any information about the gunman or a possible motive but are urging anyone with information surrounding the shooting or footage from the rap music video to contact the police at 202-727-9099. 
Earlier this year, Ayana McAllister’s cousin, Carrington Carter, was also shot and killed in Capitol Heights. 
Upon news of the shooting, Saint Augustine’s University tweeted out their condolences to McAllister’s family. Please pray for the family, Anthony McAllister, '88, wife Tyreese & daughter Ndaja, '20, as they mourn the loss of their daughter & sister. https://t.co/BmKFNF97FW 
— Saint Augustine's (@SAU_News) March 21, 2017 #BreakingNews – @SAU_News student Ayana McAllister shot and killed at rap video shoot while on spring break in Washington, DC pic.twitter.com/iAgDdiXGOv 
— Derek Rowles (@DerekRowles) March 21, 2017 Subscribe to DX Newsletter Get The Most Important Stories Of The Day Straight To Your Inbox Thank You! Thank You! Thank You!
